msbt.message: Look how round and shiny this horned dynastid is You can tell this bug was raised with love!
Imagine getting pinched by the mandibles on this giant stag! It hurts just thinking about it.
The curved mandibles on this saw stag look like polished wood carvings. They're so elaborate!
The horns mean this horned hercules is a male. They use them to try to intimidate each other. I bet it works!
I'm scared to look away from this mantis I feel like it's just waiting for a chance to pounce on me!
All the amazing colors on this Madagascan sunset moth look like they were painted on!
This scarab beetle is so shiny that I think I see myself reflected in it!
This great purple emperor sure has one majestic pair of wings! I feel like I should be bowing
The light reflects different colors off this jewel beetle, depending on what angle you look at it from.
Do you think this agrias butterfly knows how pretty its wings are?
The emperor butterfly looks sooo different when it closes its wings. That vivid blue justdisappears!
There's something so romantic about fireflies. Shining a light in the darkness to find each other
It's almost as big as my face! Seems wrong to call something so humongous an "insect."
That Queen Alexandra's birdwing is as big as a bird! It's ginormous!
It can sting you with that tail, but it's also got those pincers. Scorpions don't play fair!
They say wasps won't sting you unless they're threatened, so I'm trying not to make sudden moves.
Fireflies seem a lot less magical in the daytime, .
Is this man-faced stink bug frowning at me? Or maybe it can just smell itself Yuck!
That leaf has legs! Just kidding I knew it was just a walking leaf.
I read that every bell cricket sings a slightly different song. Hard to tell if that's true
Look at this empty cicada shell. It looks like a sleeping insect before you realize it's just a hollow casing
The rosalia batesi beetle has such an eye-catching color scheme It's one stylish-looking bug!
The damselfly has such a thin body. I guess that makes it easier to fly, but it also seems really delicate.
I read that a mosquito can't pop a balloon by biting it, though I'm not really sure why it'd want to.
I just remembered that you're the one who caught this bug! Must be cool to see it on display here.
Look at them go! Yikes, I hope they don't hurt each other!
